sections.heading: not granted; when.No injunction shall be granted by a judge, after a motion therefor has been overruled on the merits of the application by this court; and where it has been refused by the court in which the action is brought, or a judge thereof, it shall not be granted to the same applicant by a co
sections.text: not granted; when.No injunction shall be granted by a judge, after a motion therefor has been overruled on the merits of the application by this court; and where it has been refused by the court in which the action is brought, or a judge thereof, it shall not be granted to the same applicant by a court of inferior jurisdiction or any judge thereof.SourceR.S.1867, Code § 259, p. 436;R.S.1913, § 7800;C.S.1922, § 8744;C.S.1929, § 20-1071;R.S.1943, § 25-1071.
